sentences.en: A deluge of manuscripts began to arrive in the post.
sentences.cn: 大量的手稿开始通过邮递涌来。

sentences.en: A deluge of personal revelation followedand the programme earned a huge following.
sentences.cn: 大量个人的故事接踵而来,这档栏目也获得了极大的成功.

sentences.en: A heavy deluge in 1957 again washed everything away.
sentences.cn: 1957年一陈暴雨又把什么都冲走了.

sentences.en: About a dozen homes were damaged in the deluge.
sentences.cn: 在这场暴雨中大约有十几家房屋被毁。
身后之事由它去吧 ( (不关我的事 ) ).

sentences.en: Even so, the data deluge is already starting to transform business, government, science and everyday life (see our special report in this issue).
sentences.cn: 尽管如此，数据洪水正在开始改变商业、政府、科学和人们的日常生活。

sentences.en: I got caught in the deluge on the way home.
sentences.cn: 我在回家的路上遇到倾盆大雨.

sentences.en: It was like a deluge from heaven.
The rain came then : a sudden deluge which pounded on the roof and against the windows.
sentences.cn: 那时倾盆大雨降临了,0榕榈厍没髯盼荻ズ痛盎А?

sentences.en: The rain came then: a sudden deluge which pounded on the roof and agaist the windows.
sentences.cn: 那时倾盆大雨降临了,砰砰地敲击着屋顶和窗户.

sentences.en: The singer was overwhelmed by the deluge of the fan mail.
sentences.cn: 这位歌手一下子不知道怎么应付大量的歌迷的来信.

sentences.en: The spring thaw caused the river to deluge the region.
sentences.cn: 春天冰雪融化，使河水泛滥淹没了那地区。

sentences.en: There was a deluge of requests for interviews and statements.
sentences.cn: 对接受访谈和发表声明的要求铺天盖地地涌来。

sentences.en: This has brought a deluge of criticism.
sentences.cn: 这一下子招来了铺天盖地的批评。

sentences.en: This little stream can become a deluge when it rains heavily.
sentences.cn: 雨大的时候,这条小溪能变作洪流.

sentences.en: When the snow melts , the mountain stream a deluge.
sentences.cn: 时, 山间溪流变成山洪暴发.

sentences.en: When the snow melts, the mountain stream becomes a deluge.
sentences.cn: 雪融化时, 山间溪流变成山洪暴发.

sentences.en: You could see him now, in this deluge of distraction.
sentences.cn: 现在你在这混乱的暴雨中,能够看见他.

phrases.tran_cn: 密集洒水系统；集水系统；雨淋灭火系统

trans.tran_en: a large flood, or period when there is a lot of rain
a large flood, or period when there is a lot of rain
to cover something with a lot of water
